chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for Family Reunion

FRP 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

FRP 2.2. DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking Family Reunion under protection claims. They must meet suitability requirements, ensuring they are not grounds for refusal under Part Suitability. No specific exceptions or thresholds are outlined in this section.

chunks.text:
### Transitional provisions

FRP 11.1. Applications made before 1500 on 4 September 2025 by a partner or child of a person with protection status will be decided under the Appendix Family Reunion (Sponsors with Protection) rules in force on that date. In any other case, the partner or child of a person with protection status must apply under Appendix FM to stay with or join that person until further notice.

Print this page
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners or children of persons with protection status applying before 4 September 2025. They must be decided under the rules in force before that date, while other applicants must apply under Appendix FM. The key condition is the application date; after that, different rules apply.

Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Family Reunion (Sponsors with Protection)
Section ID: FRP 11.1
Section: Transitional provisions
Topic: family

Summary: This provision applies to partners or children of persons with protection status applying before 4 September 2025. They must be decided under the rules in force before that date, while other applicants must apply under Appendix FM. The key condition is the application date; after that, different rules apply.

### Transitional provisions

FRP 11.1. Applications made before 1500 on 4 September 2025 by a partner or child of a person with protection status will be decided under the Appendix Family Reunion (Sponsors with Protection) rules in force on that date. In any other case, the partner or child of a person with protection status must apply under Appendix FM to stay with or join that person until further notice.

Print this page
